Re-experience the <command_color=common_03> episodes of Final Fantasy VII</color>. 
As you proceed through the story, you will unlock episodes of other titles from within the FFVII series.

A single party is comprised of <command_color=common_03>up to three characters.</color> Tap to change characters and their equipment.
<command_color=common_02>*The character in the center is the party leader and the one you control at the beginning of battle.</color>

A character's <command_color=common_03>Power</color> is determined by their attributes and equipment, 
and a party's <command_color=common_03>Total Power</color> by the sum of all characters' power. 
Every battle has a <command_color=common_03>recommended power value</color> that indicates the battle's difficulty.
<command_color=common_02>*Recommended power is only displayed before battle.</color>

You can check the <command_color=common_03>details of a battle beforehand.</color> 
Tap <command_color=common_03>Recommended Party</color> to automatically create an optimal party for that battle.
In Story Party mode, <command_color=common_03>parties are created automatically,</color> but you can change the characters' equipment.

In <command_color=common_03>Solo Content,</color> you can take on quests to collect weapon enhancement materials 
or attempt difficult battles with a stronger party.

Progress through the <command_color=common_03>Battle Tower</color> to <command_color=common_03>unlock new features</color>. 
The tower's <command_color=common_03>Battle Effect</color> will <command_color=common_03>influence your party's performance</color>. 
Therefore, it's crucial to strategize considering this effect.

<command_color=common_03>Enhancement quests</color> reward materials and lots of EXP, making them <command_color=common_03>vital for 
enhancing weapons, synthesizing materia, and strengthening characters.</color>
<command_color=common_02>*Enhancement quests require <sprite="tmp_icon" index=782>(stamina).</color>
You can revisit and explore the <command_color=common_03>dungeons</color> from the story. As you make progress, more will be unlocked.

<command_color=common_03>Daily quests</color> are comprised of different types of requests that yield rewards.
<command_color=common_02>*Requests reset at every day.</color>

<command_color=common_03>Summon quests</color> allow you to battle different summons,
after which you can unlock their <command_color=common_03>Summon Streams.</color>
<command_color=common_02>*Summon quests require <sprite="tmp_icon" index=782>(stamina).</color>
Through <command_color=common_03>Story quests</color>, you can learn more about characters' backgrounds.
In this challenge, the goal is to deal as much damage as possible within the allotted time. High scores will be recorded for each stage.

A single party is comprised of <command_color=common_03>up to 3 characters.</color>
Tap to change characters and their equipment.
<command_color=common_02>*The character in the center is the party leader and the one you control at the beginning of battle.</color>

<command_color=common_03>Power</color> is determined by character's stats and equipment, and a <command_color=common_03>Total Power</color> by the sum of all power. 
Every battle has a <command_color=common_03>Recommended Power</color> that indicates the battle's difficulty.
<command_color=common_02>*Recommended power is only displayed before battle.</color>

You can <command_color=common_03>check the details of a battle</color> beforehand. 
Tap <command_color=common_03>Rcmd. Party</color> to automatically create an optimal party for that battle.

In Co-op, players control one character and form parties with others.
<command_color=common_03>Random matches require 3 characters to form a party</color>, while private matches <command_color=common_03>only require 2.</color>

Random matches have a <command_color=common_03>required Power value</color> that you must meet.
<command_color=common_02>*This is not required for private matches.</color>

This feature allows you to <command_color=common_03>explore dungeons from the story</color> once more.
Clear the dungeon for rewards, and complete dungeon-specific missions for additional rewards.

<command_color=common_03>Criterion Dungeons</color> contain Symbol enemies, and if you encounter them, <command_color=common_03>a battle will begin.</color>
Damage taken during the battle <command_color=common_03>will affect your max HP.</color>
U. C. abilities used will not be reset.

<command_color=common_03>Items specific to dungeons</color> can only be used <command_color=common_03>inside each respective dungeon</color>.

<command_color=common_02>*Items specific to dungeons cannot be taken outside.</color>
<command_color=common_03>Crisis Dungeons</color> are Criterion Dungeons with a higher difficulty level.

Crisis Dungeons require <command_color=common_03><sprite="tmp_icon" index=775>(dungeon keys).</color>
3<sprite="tmp_icon" index=775> are <command_color=common_03>replenished weekly, but they can also be <command_color=common_03>obtained with crystals.</color>

Each dungeon has<command_color=common_03> Trance Abilities</color> with various effects. 
After defeating a Symbol enemy, you will be <command_color=common_03>awarded an additional Trance Ability.</color>
 <command_color=common_02>*You can choose 1 Trance Ability upon defeating a Symbol enemy.</color>
Defeating a symbol enemy will <command_color=common_03>increase the Crisis Level,</color> which will in turn make enemies stronger.

To participate in Co-op battles, you can <command_color=common_03>create a lobby to search for other players,</color> 
or <command_color=common_03>join another player's lobby by invitation or lobby ID search.</color>

There are two types of Co-op battles: <command_color=common_03>private matches and random matches.</color>
Team up with friends in private matches or automatically join a party by randomly matching with other players.

To participate in <command_color=common_03>random matches</color>, your Power must meet the required Power value shown in the stage details.

In addition, in <command_color=common_03>Co-op battles</color>, you can challenge without consuming <sprite="tmp_icon" index=782>(Stamina)
until you clear it for the first time.

In Co-op battles, you can use the special ability <command_color=common_03>Raise</color>.
Using Raise will <command_color=common_03>revive fallen allies</color>.
<command_color=common_02>*Each character can only be revived once per player.</color>

Upon completing Co-op battles, you can acquire <command_color=common_03><sprite="tmp_icon" index=771>Co-op medals</color>.
<sprite="tmp_icon" index=771>Co-op medals can be used at the exchange.
Teaming up with friends increases the amount of medals earned per battle.
<command_color=common_02>*There is a limit to the amount of <sprite="tmp_icon" index=771>Co-op medals that can be obtained within a week.</color>

When teaming up with another player for the 1st time, you will receive a <command_color=common_03>first time match reward.</color>
<command_color=common_03>1-30 players: Blue Crystal x100
31-50 players: Blue Crystal x50
51-200 players: Blue Crystal x10
201+ players: Co-op Medals</color>

At the <command_color=common_03>Chocobo Farm</color>, Bill oversees the <command_color=common_03>chocobo expeditions</color>, Chloe runs <command_color=common_03>the exchange</color>, 
and Billy tends the stables that allow you to <command_color=common_03>view and retire your chocobos</color>.

Through <command_color=common_03>chocobo expeditions</color>, you will <command_color=common_03>discover items after a set amount of time</color>. 
The time and items vary with each chocobo's abilities.
Characters sent on an expedition will <command_color=common_03>earn EXP</color>.

Expedition areas feature various terrain, and only chocobos <command_color=common_03>capable of traversing the corresponding terrain</color> can be dispatched. Tap and hold on a chocobo to view their <command_color=common_03>field aptitude</color>.

In <command_color=common_03>Characters</color>, you can <command_color=common_03>boost characters' stats or acquire and enhance Limit Breaks and Overspeed.</color>
In <command_color=common_03>Summons</color>, you can <command_color=common_03>bind Summons and acquire and enhance their abilities.</color>

<command_color=common_03>Unlocking nodes</color> increases the stat as shown on the node. You can also acquire <command_color=common_03>new Limit Breaks</color> in this fashion.

<command_color=common_02>*Character-specific or common memories are required to unlock nodes.</color>

New limit breaks can be acquired by <command_color=common_03>completing all requisite Unlock Missions.</color>
<command_color=common_03>One mission per character can be attempted at once.</color>
<command_color=common_02>*Starting a mission triggers a cooldown timer. You must wait before you can select a different mission.</color>
Missions can also be viewed from <command_color=common_03>Stream Missions</color> in the menu screen.

Summons can be bound by completing the respective <command_color=common_03>Pact Missions</color> and enhanced by unlocking their nodes. 
Completion of the corresponding <command_color=common_03>Unlock Missions</color> awards new abilities.

<command_color=common_02>*Summon memories are required to unlock nodes.</color>

Only one Pact and Unlock Mission <command_color=common_03>across all summons can be attempted at once.</color>
<command_color=common_02>*Starting a mission triggers a cooldown timer. You must wait before you can select a different mission.</color>
Missions can also be viewed from <command_color=common_03>Stream Missions</color> in the menu screen.

<command_color=common_03>Enhance Weapons</color> allows you to <command_color=common_03>strengthen your weapons.</color>
<command_color=common_03>Enhance Ultimate Weapons</color> allows you to <command_color=common_03>strengthen your ultimate weapons.</color>
<command_color=common_03>Enhance Materia</color> allows you to <command_color=common_03>strengthen and sell your materia.</color>
<command_color=common_03>Synthesis</color> allows you to <command_color=common_03>create materia with the recipes you have.</color>

<command_color=common_03>Enhance Materia</color> allows you to <command_color=common_03>strengthen and level up your materia using materials and other materia.</color>
When you level up a materia, <command_color=common_03>its ability's effects are enhanced,</color> and at certain levels, <command_color=common_03>sub stats are unlocked or enhanced.</color>

When a materia reaches max level, it can be <command_color=common_03>upgraded</color> into a more powerful materia. 
<command_color=common_03>Upgrading a materia may also increase its rarity.</color>

<command_color=common_03>Enhance Weapons</color> allows you to strengthen and level up your weapons. 
When a weapon reaches max level, its level can be <command_color=common_03>uncapped.</color> 
Uncapping a weapon's level <command_color=common_03>unlocks and strengthens R. abilities, as well as unlocking support materia.</color>

The rarity of <sprite="tmp_icon" index=192><sprite="tmp_icon" index=192><sprite="tmp_icon" index=192><sprite="tmp_icon" index=192> weapons or lower can be increased, <command_color=common_03>raising its max level</color>.
  
<sprite="tmp_icon" index=196><sprite="tmp_icon" index=196><sprite="tmp_icon" index=196><sprite="tmp_icon" index=196><sprite="tmp_icon" index=196> weapons can be <command_color=common_03>overboosted</color>, enhancing stats, C. Abilities, and R. Abilities.

<command_color=common_02>*A + will appear next to <sprite="tmp_icon" index=198> from the 11th tier onward.</color>

<command_color=common_03>HP:</color> This value represents a character's health. When reduced to 0, the character is KO'd.
<command_color=common_03>PATK:</color> This value affects physical damage dealt.
<command_color=common_03>MATK:</color> This value affects magic damage dealt.
<command_color=common_02>*The stats of weapon slots, sub weapons, and materia are added to the characters' stats.
*Sub weapon stats are calculated at 50%.</color>

<command_color=common_03>PDEF:</color> This value affects physical damage taken.
<command_color=common_03>MDEF:</color> This value affects magic damage taken.
<command_color=common_03>HEAL:</color> This value affects amount of HP recovered.
<command_color=common_02>*The stats of weapon slots, sub weapons, and materia are added to the characters' stats.
*Sub weapon stats are calculated at 50%.</color>

<command_color=common_03>C. abilities (Command abilities):</color> Abilities used in battle that consume ATB.
<command_color=common_03>R. abilities (Reinforcement abilities):</color> Passive abilities that are always in effect.

Each weapon has three <command_color=common_03>Support Materia</color> that become unlocked at certain levels.
The <command_color=common_03>S. abilities (Support abilities) of support materia affect the materia with which they're paired.</color>
Depending on the pairing, these abilities may have no effect.
If you have a weapon you'd like to enhance, you can go to Enhance Weapons from the Weapon Details screen.
<command_color=common_03>Branding stones</color> can be used to <command_color=common_03>brand</color> weapons and apply <command_color=common_03>up to three random effects</color>.

<command_color=common_03>Duplicate weapons can be stored in the armory</color> and can also be <command_color=common_03>converted into weapon parts</color> used to increase the rarity of or overboost weapons.
<command_color=common_02>*Turning on auto-convert will automatically convert any weapons sent to the armory.</color>

You can <command_color=common_03>select a materia to create</color>, and after a set amount of time, <command_color=common_03>the materia will be complete.</color>
<command_color=common_03>A recipe is needed to create materia.</color>
 
A materia's <command_color=common_03>rarity and sub stats are determined upon completion.</color>
Tap and hold recipes to view details, such as where it can be obtained.

Materia creation can be expedited through <command_color=common_03>Shorten Duration.</color>
<command_color=common_02>*A synthesis bookmark is required.</color>

<command_color=common_03>Additional materials</color> can now be used during synthesis. Adding a certain amount of materials will affect the materia's outcome.
 
<command_color=common_02>*The additional materials that can be used vary with each materia type.</color>

You can create different parties for solo and co-op. <command_color=common_03>Solo formations</color> are comprised of a party of up to three characters.
<command_color=common_03>Co-op formations</color> contain a single character for use in battle.

Equipment affects a character's <command_color=common_03>Power, stats, C. Abilities (Command Abilities), 
U. C. Abilities (Ultimate Command Abilities), L. Abilities (Limit Abilities), and R. Abilities (Reinforcement Abilities).</color>

<command_color=common_03>HP:</color> This value represents a character's health. When reduced to 0, the character is KO'd.
<command_color=common_03>PATK:</color> This value affects physical damage dealt.
<command_color=common_03>MATK:</color> This value affects magic damage dealt.
<command_color=common_02>*The stats of various weapon slots, sub weapons and materia are reflected.</color>
<command_color=common_02>*50% of a sub weapon's stats are reflected.</color>

<command_color=common_03>PDEF:</color> This value affects physical damage taken.
<command_color=common_03>MDEF:</color> This value affects magic damage taken.
<command_color=common_03>HEAL:</color> This value affects amount of HP restored.
<command_color=common_02>*The stats of various weapon slots, sub weapons and materia are reflected.</color>
<command_color=common_02>*50% of a sub weapon's stats are reflected.</color>

These abilities are used in battle and consume the ATB gauge.
<command_color=common_02>*The C. abilities of main weapons, ability weapons, and materia are reflected.</color>

These powerful abilities are used in battle and consume the limit gauge. 
Either a <command_color=common_03>Limit Break</color> or <command_color=common_03>Summon Ability</color> can be equipped.

<command_color=common_03>Limit Break:</color> An ability specific to each character.
<command_color=common_03>Summon ability:</color> An ability that can be used once a summon is bound.
<command_color=common_02>*Each summon ability can be equipped by only one character in a party.</color>

These abilities are always in effect during battle. As their point total increases, they level up and grow stronger.
<command_color=common_02>*The R. abilities of main weapons, gear, ability weapons, ultimate weapons, and sub weapons are reflected.
*50% of ability weapon and sub weapon points are reflected.</color>

These abilities affect and strengthen the effects of the materia with which they're paired.
<command_color=common_02>*Abilities may not have any effect depending on the pairing.</color>

Stats, C. abilities, R. abilities, Brands, and <command_color=common_03>Support Materia</color> of main weapons are reflected as well as the weapon's appearance.
<command_color=common_02>*Only character-specific weapons can be equipped.</color>

The <command_color=common_03>effects of support materia are triggered based on a weapon's max level.</color> The <command_color=common_03>S. abilities of support materia affect the materia with which they're paired.</color> Depending on the pairing, these abilities may have no effect.

The appearance and R. abilities of <command_color=common_03>gear</color> are reflected. If worn as a <command_color=common_03>costume</color>, however, only their <command_color=common_03>appearance will be reflected.</color>

The <command_color=common_03>stats, C. abilities, R. abilities, and Brands of ability weapons are reflected.</color>
<command_color=common_02>*Only character-specific weapons can be equipped.
*These weapons are not reflected in the character's appearance.
*50% of stats are reflected.
*50% of R. ability points are reflected.</color>
The C. Abilities and sub stats of <command_color=common_03>materia</color> are reflected. Their effects are increased based on the support materia with which they're paired.

The stats, Brands, and R. Abilities of <command_color=common_03>sub weapons</color> are reflected.
<command_color=common_02>*Ultimate weapons cannot be equipped as sub weapons.
*These weapons are not reflected in the character's appearance.
*50% of stats are reflected.
*50% of R. Ability pts are reflected.</color>

These abilities can be used in battle by equipping ultimate weapons. 
They can be used without consuming ATB, but there is <color=#95C7FF>a limit to the number of times</color> 
they can be used in a single battle and may require time to <color=#95C7FF>recharge</color>.

Stats, U. C. abilities, R. abilities, and brands of <command_color=common_03>ultimate weapons</color> are reflected.
<command_color=common_02>*Ultimate weapons are specific to each character and are not reflected in their appearance.</color>

O. abilities provide characters with <command_color=common_03>temporary enhancements</color> when used. These abilities charge over time, and the duration of enhancements changes <command_color=common_03>based on the time charged</color>.

On the <command_color=common_03>draw screen</color>, you can perform a variety of draws by expending <command_color=common_03>blue crystals</color>, <command_color=common_03>red crystals</color>, and <command_color=common_03>tickets</color>. Some draws are available for <command_color=common_03>free</color>.

In <command_color=common_03>a part of Draw</color>, a <command_color=common_03>10 Draw</color> will yield one or several stamps for your <command_color=common_03>stamp card</color>.
Once stamped, you will receive the reward in a given square.
<command_color=common_02>*Stamp cards can be viewed from stamp card details.</color>

Stamp cards sometimes have <command_color=common_03>Select squares</color> that allow you to <command_color=common_03>select one reward from several.</color>
<command_color=common_02>*It is possible to change the reward from stamp card details before that square is stamped.</color>

New Weapon Featured Draws have a <command_color=common_03>Wish List</color>. 
Weapons in the Wish List have <command_color=common_03>better odds of being obtained.</color>

The featured weapons in the ongoing New Weapon Featured Draw are pre-determined. 
The odds are increased for both these<command_color=common_03> featured weapons and selected weapons</color>.
If a <command_color=common_03>duplicate weapon of a higher rarity is obtained</color>, the <command_color=common_03>rarity of the same weapon currently held will increase to match.</color>

Additionally, any <command_color=common_03>duplicate weapons obtained will be sent to the armory</color>. The rarity of the weapons sent is determined by <command_color=common_03>their rarity before upgrades</color>, if an upgrade occurred. If no upgrade occurred, the <command_color=common_03>obtained weapon's original rarity</color> is used.
Events are <command_color=common_03>special limited-time content.</color> Some events <command_color=common_03>have requirements for participation.</color>
Completing <command_color=common_03>missions</color> yields <command_color=common_03>various rewards</color>. They can be viewed from Missions in the home screen or from the menu screen.

In Daily Missions and Weekly Missions, you can earn <command_color=common_03>pts by completing them</color>. You can receive rewards each time you reach certain point thresholds.
<command_color=common_02>*Pts and mission details for Daily Missions reset daily, and Weekly Missions reset weekly.</color>

In the <command_color=common_03>shop</color>, <command_color=common_03>crystals and gil can be used to purchase different items.</color> Some shops and items are only available for a limited time or have a limited quantity.

In some shops, the <command_color=common_03>lineup is refilled automatically after a set amount of time.</color> They may also allow you to refill items at will.
<command_color=common_02>*There is a limit to the number of times items can be refilled in a day.
*Some exchanges or items are only available for a limited time or have a limited quantity.</color>

At the <command_color=common_03>Exchange</color>, items such as medals <command_color=common_03>can be traded for other items.</color>
 <command_color=common_02>*Some shops and items are only available for a limited time or have a limited quantity.</color>

You can check the items in your inventory from <command_color=common_03>Items</color>. You can also <command_color=common_03>jump to the locations where items can be obtained from Acquired Via.</color>

In the <command_color=common_03>battle tower</color>, each floor has different <command_color=common_03>battle effects</color> that are active during battle. These effects should be taken into consideration when creating a strategy.

The objective of the <command_color=common_03>battle tower</color> is to fight the enemies on each floor and make your way to the bottom. There are different towers, and a suitable strategy is needed for each one.

<command_color=common_03>Daily Quests</color> are comprised of requests that yield rewards.
 <command_color=common_02>*Requests reset at 5AM every day.</color>

Some requests allow you to <command_color=common_03>choose the rewards you want.</color> Upon completion, <command_color=common_03>one will be awarded at random from your selection.</color>
 
There are <command_color=common_03>special requests</color> that yield more rewards, and some that yield additional rewards.

<command_color=common_03>Summon Quests</color> allow you to battle different Summons, after which you can unlock their respective Summon Streams.
 <command_color=common_02>*Summon quests require <sprite="tmp_icon" index=782>(stamina).</color>
Through <command_color=common_03>Story Quests</color>, you can <command_color=common_03>learn more about characters' backgrounds.</color>

<command_color=common_03>Gender</color>: The chocobo's gender.
<command_color=common_03>Rank</color>: The chocobo's performance.
<command_color=common_03>Field Aptitude</color>: The terrain to which the chocobo is suited to traverse.

<command_color=common_03>Speed</color>: This affects the time it takes to complete an expedition.
<command_color=common_03>Stamina</color>: This affects the amount of expedition rewards obtained.
<command_color=common_03>Intellect</color>: This affects the chance to obtain rare items or chocobo medals on expeditions.
<command_color=common_03>Adaptability</color>: This affects the amount of character EXP obtained during expeditions.

<command_color=common_03>EXP, enhancement materials</color>, and <command_color=common_03>synthesis materials</color> can be obtained from each quest.
 
<command_color=common_02>*<sprite="tmp_icon" index=782>(Stamina) is required to attempt these quests.</color>
At the Workshop, weapon parts can be <command_color=common_03>converted to weapon medals</color>, which can be used at the exchange.
The story is divided into EP (episodes), with some that include dungeons and battles.

You can take on story battles in <command_color=common_03>Story Party</color> mode, which limits the formation to characters pertinent to the story, or <command_color=common_03>Free Party</color> mode, which allows you to form parties of your choice.
 
Story Party mode yields <command_color=common_03>bonus rewards.</color>
<command_color=common_02>*Free Party mode becomes available as you progress through the story.</color>
A guild levels up when its members obtain a certain amount of guild EXP. Guild EXP can be obtained from means such as <command_color=common_03>guild login bonuses and guild missions</color>.

<command_color=common_03>Guild bonuses</color> are effects that are automatically granted to everyone in the guild. The guildmaster and submasters can use bonus points to <command_color=common_03>unlock or enhance</color> these bonuses.
<command_color=common_02>*Guild bonus points can be obtained by guild members.</color>

<command_color=common_03>The guild roster and records</color> can be viewed from the menu. The guildmaster and submasters can also <command_color=common_03>change the guild's emblem, wallpaper, and search conditions</color>.
You can use the <command_color=common_03>Chat</color> feature to communicate with guild members through text and stamps and even receive co-op battle invitations.

Leaving guilds twice in a single day will trigger a <command_color=common_03>24-hour cooldown</color>. You cannot create a guild or send requests to other guilds during this time.
<command_color=common_02>*You will automatically be removed from a guild if you fail to log in to the guild for 14 days.</color>

The guild's <command_color=common_03>emblem, wallpaper, and search conditions</color> can be changed through Settings in the guild menu.
<command_color=common_02>*The Settings option will only display for the guildmaster and submasters.</color>

You can view the guild's roster from Members. Submasters <command_color=common_03>manage the roster and can accept players' requests to join the guild</color>. The guildmaster has <command_color=common_03>administrative privileges</color> such as assigning submasters.

Guild event records, individual records, and the guild's emblem and wallpaper can be viewed from Guild Records.
<command_color=common_02>*Guild emblems and wallpapers obtained will automatically be shared with the guild.</color>
With Guild Search, you can search for guilds by <command_color=common_03>guild ID or certain conditions</color>. You can also save guilds to your <command_color=common_03>watch list</color>.
Guild missions reward <command_color=common_03>guild EXP and guild bonus points</color>, both which are shared with the guild.
The <command_color=common_03>Chat</color> feature allows you to communicate with members in your guild. Stamps can also be used by selecting them from the list.
Through co-op battle private matching, you can select <command_color=common_03>Invite Guild</color> to send a message to and invite members from your guild.

Any messages posted in the Chat feature by a blocked player will not be displayed.
<command_color=common_02>*You can block a player from their profile.
*This does not affect co-op battle matching.</color>

In <command_color=common_03>guild battles</color>, the guild ranking is determined by <command_color=common_03>the total score obtained by each guild</color> during the event.
<command_color=common_02>*There is a limit to the guild battles each player can attempt in a single day.</color>

Guild battle bosses have a massive amount of HP, and any damage dealt <command_color=common_03>will be carried over into the next battle</color>. 
<command_color=common_03>Damage dealt by other guild members</color> will also be reflected in the bosses' HP.

Depleting the boss's HP a set amount <command_color=common_03>will yield an additional score bonus</color>. 
For battles with multiple bosses, depleting the <command_color=common_03>bosses' total HP a set amount</color> will yield a score bonus. 
Defeating the bosses in each battle <command_color=common_03>will yield rewards for all guild members.</color>
<command_color=common_02>*If a battle has multiple bosses, all bosses must be defeated in order to earn the reward.</color>

Defeated bosses are <command_color=common_03>revived at a certain time.</color> Defeating all of the bosses <command_color=common_03>will revive all bosses immediately</color>.
<command_color=common_02>*The HP of undefeated bosses will not be restored when revived.</color>

Guild battles allow for the use of <command_color=common_03>additional equipment</color>, in which spare weapons and gear can be set to <command_color=common_03>increase the potency of abilities</color>. 
These weapons and gear have points, and <command_color=common_03>the effect is increased based on the point total</color>.
<command_color=common_02>*Weapon points vary based on weapon enhancements.
*Characters' current equipment cannot be set as additional equipment.
*Ultimate weapons cannot be set as additional equipment.</color>

<command_color=common_03>Mock battles</color> do not yield scores or rewards, but allow players to <command_color=common_03>take on guild battles without using any attempts</color>.
<command_color=common_02>*Only mock battles are available during the strategy period.
*The bosses' HP in mock battles are not shared among guild members.</color>

Weapons and gear have points, and <command_color=common_03>effects are increased based on the point total</color>.
<command_color=common_02>*Weapon points vary based on weapon enhancements.</color>

<command_color=common_03>Link (back up) game data</color> with your Square Enix Members account.
<command_color=common_02>*If this does not trigger a "mission complete" notification, please return to the data link screen or restart the game.</color>

After installing the game on Steam, select <command_color=common_03>"Link Data"</color> from the title screen and complete the process to continue your game with the Steam version.
<command_color=common_02>*If you started with the Steam version, link (back up) your game data, and follow the steps above from the app's title screen to continue your game with the app.</color>

The Highwind sets out on automated expeditions, <command_color=common_03>allowing you to collect items after a certain period of time</color>. These items can be used for <command_color=common_03>Airship Enhancement</color>, and the act of collecting them may lead you to discover enemies, triggering <command_color=common_03>Airship Battles</color>. Items can be collected instantly with <command_color=common_03>Highwind Boosters</color>.

Through Airship Enhancement, you can <command_color=common_03>enhance the Highwind and its parts with items you've collected</color>. Doing so will <command_color=common_03>increase your item collection efficiency and discovery rate of rare items</color>.

Enhancing the airship unlocks Airship Battles, and winning these battles yield <command_color=common_03>collection items and rare items</color>.
<command_color=common_02>*Some Airship Battles are only available for a certain period of time.</color>

Collection items have effects that <command_color=common_03>strengthen your characters</color> by simply possessing them. <command_color=common_03>Fulfilling certain conditions will allow you to enhance these items</color> and boost their effects.

Ultimate weapons can be strengthened through <command_color=common_03>weapon enhancement</color>.
<command_color=common_02>*Unlike standard weapons, they cannot be overboosted or have their rarity upgraded.</color>
<command_color=common_03>Branding stones</color> can be used to <command_color=common_03>brand</color> weapons and apply <command_color=common_03>up to three random effects</color>.
<command_color=common_03>U. C. abilities (Ultimate Command abilities)</color>: Abilities used in battle. They do not consume ATB.
In this challenge, the goal is to deal as much damage as possible within the allotted time. Some gauges will be partly filled at the start of battle, and high scores will be recorded for each stage.
Each stage has its own ranking. The rankings do not reset and reflect the results over the entire period.

In <command_color=common_03>Free Challenge</color>, you can set <command_color=common_03>battle effects</color> of your choice. Setting these effects will increase the <command_color=common_03>stage level</color>, which will yield <command_color=common_03>battle score and point bonuses</color>.
<command_color=common_03>Battle effects</color> can be set before taking on a quest.
The type and potency of effects differ with each battle, so <command_color=common_03>find the best combination</color> for each situation.

In role streams, you can acquire new <command_color=common_03>overspeeds</color>. You can also <command_color=common_03>unlock nodes</color> to improve various stats.
 <command_color=common_02>*Specific items are required to unlock nodes.</color>

New overspeeds can be acquired by clearing all <command_color=common_03>Unlock Missions</color>. Only <command_color=common_03>one mission</color> can be attempted <command_color=common_03>per character at a time</color>.
Missions can also be viewed from <command_color=common_03>Stream Missions</color> in the menu screen.

<command_color=common_03>Crash Battles</color> are extremely challenging stages.
<command_color=common_02>*Accelerated Mode cannot be used in Crash Battles.</color>

If even one player clears a Crash Battle, <command_color=common_03>everyone will be able to participate in a Frenzy Battle</color> held at a later date. The more players that clear the battle, the better the rewards.
